caption.p: Upon interaction with reactive oxygen and nitrogen species (ROS/RNS), proteins can undergo a wide range of reversible and irreversible chemical modifications. Among the most commonly formed functional groups and products are S-nitrosothiol (SNO), sulfenic acid (SOH), disulfides with protein thiols or low molecular mass thiols (e.g., with glutathione, SSG), sulfinic acid (SO 2H), sulfonic acid (SO 3H), nitrotryptophan, nitrotyrosine, and dityrosine. Adapted from ref ( 317). Copyright 2013 American Chemical Society.
